Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the interior is slightly ribbed and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393367) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393367)
